WRK008.Name: Deployment Selector Without Matching Pods
WRK008.Description: Detects Deployments whose spec.selector does not match any existing Pods. This results in 0 replicas running.
WRK008.Recommendation: Ensure that pod labels match the Deployment selector.
WRK008.Message: No issues detected for Deployment Selector Without Matching Pods.

SEC008.Name: Secrets in Environment Variables
SEC008.Description: Detects secrets injected into pods via environment variables using env.valueFrom.secretKeyRef. This makes secrets easier to leak through logs or /proc inspection.
SEC008.Recommendation: Avoid exposing secrets in environment variables. Mount secrets as volumes instead.

Items.Issue: Secret argocd-redis exposed via env var in container argocd-application-controller

AKSBP010.Name: Customized MC_ Resource Group Name
AKSBP010.Recommendation: Customized MC_ Resource Group Name is enabled.

EVENT001.Name: Grouped Warning Events
EVENT001.Description: Groups recent Warning events by Reason and Message.
EVENT001.Recommendation: Check for recurring issues. Investigate sources using `kubectl describe` or logs.
EVENT001.Message: No issues detected for Grouped Warning Events.

WRK002.Name: Deployment Missing Replicas
WRK002.Description: Detects Deployments where the number of available replicas is less than desired.
WRK002.Recommendation: Check Deployments that are not meeting their replica count. This may indicate rollout issues or failed pods.
WRK002.Message: No issues detected for Deployment Missing Replicas.

SEC003.Name: Pods Running as Root
SEC003.Description: Detects pods running with UID 0 or no explicit runAsUser setting (defaults to root).
SEC003.Recommendation: Avoid running pods as root by explicitly setting runAsUser to a non-zero UID in pod or container securityContext.

SEC010.Name: HostPath Volume Usage
SEC010.Description: Flags pods that use hostPath volumes, which mount parts of the host filesystem. This bypasses isolation and can be dangerous if misused.
SEC010.Recommendation: Avoid using hostPath unless absolutely necessary. Use persistent volumes instead.

SEC005.Name: Pods Using hostIPC
SEC005.Description: Detects pods that use hostIPC, which can compromise pod isolation and allow access to shared memory on the host.
SEC005.Recommendation: Avoid using hostIPC in pods unless absolutely required for specific functionality.
SEC005.Message: No issues detected for Pods Using hostIPC.

NS001.Name: Empty Namespaces
NS001.Description: Finds namespaces with no running pods.
NS001.Recommendation: These may be stale or unused and safe to delete after verifying they contain no critical resources.

NS002.Name: Missing or Weak ResourceQuotas
NS002.Description: Detects namespaces with missing or incomplete ResourceQuota definitions.
NS002.Recommendation: Apply CPU, memory, and pod quotas to enforce fair resource usage.

AKSSEC001.FailMessage: Cluster API server is publicly accessible, increasing security risks.
AKSSEC001.Name: Private Cluster
AKSSEC001.Recommendation: Configure the cluster as a private cluster to restrict API server access to your virtual network.

Items.Issue: Configure the cluster as a private cluster to restrict API server access to your virtual network.

POD004.Name: Pending Pods
POD004.Description: Detects pods stuck in a 'Pending' state due to scheduling or resource issues.
POD004.Recommendation: Inspect scheduling constraints, resource availability, and missing dependencies.
POD004.Message: No issues detected for Pending Pods.

RBAC004.Name: Orphaned and Ineffective Roles
RBAC004.Description: Flags Roles and ClusterRoles that are unused, lack subjects, or define no rules.
RBAC004.Recommendation: Delete Roles and ClusterRoles that are not bound or do not define any rules.

Items.Message: ClusterRoleBinding has no subjects
Unused ClusterRole
Unused ClusterRole
ClusterRole has no rules

WRK005.Name: Missing Resource Requests or Limits
WRK005.Description: Checks for containers that are missing CPU or memory resource requests or limits.
WRK005.Recommendation: Specify resource requests and limits on all containers.

NET004.Name: Namespace Missing Network Policy
NET004.Description: Detects namespaces that have running pods but no associated NetworkPolicy resources. This could allow unrestricted pod-to-pod communication.
NET004.Recommendation: Apply a default deny-all ingress/egress NetworkPolicy in each namespace that hosts workloads, then selectively allow traffic as needed.

SEC007.Name: Missing Pod Security Admission Labels
SEC007.Description: Checks if namespaces are missing the 'pod-security.kubernetes.io/enforce' label required for Pod Security Admission enforcement.
SEC007.Recommendation: Add 'pod-security.kubernetes.io/enforce' labels to your namespaces to enforce Pod Security standards. Use values like 'baseline' or 'restricted'.

SEC011.Name: Containers Running as UID 0
SEC011.Description: Detects containers explicitly set to run as user 0 (root).
SEC011.Recommendation: Avoid setting runAsUser to 0. Use non-root UIDs for better isolation.

SEC009.Description: Checks containers that don't drop all Linux capabilities via securityContext.capabilities.drop = ['ALL'].
SEC009.Recommendation: Explicitly drop all Linux capabilities unless specific ones are needed.

WRK007.Recommendation: Add readiness and liveness probes to all containers to improve availability and fault detection.
